edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Class ElGamalAbs

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ElGamalAbs
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsymmetricEnc, ElGamalEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScElGamalKEM, ScElGamalOnByteArray, ScElGamalOnGroupElement

    public abstract class ElGamalAbs
extends java.lang.Object
implements ElGamalEnc
    Abstract class that implements some common functionality to all ElGamal types.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name to create and sets it to the underlying group.
      ElGamalAbs(java.lang.String dlogName, java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
      Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name to create and random number generator to use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElGamalAbs

        public ElGamalAbs()
        Default constructor. Uses the default implementations of DlogGroup, CryptographicHash and SecureRandom.

      • ElGamalAbs

        public ElGamalAbs(DlogGroup dlogGroup)
           throws SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup and sets it to the underlying group. It lets SCAPI choose and source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroup - underlying DlogGroup to use, it has to have DDH security level
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group is not DDH secure

      • ElGamalAbs

        public ElGamalAbs(DlogGroup dlogGroup,
          java.security.SecureRandom random)
           throws SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup and source of randomness.
        Parameters:
        dlogGroup - must be DDH secure.
        random - source of randomness.
        Throws:
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group is not DDH secure

      • ElGamalAbs

        public ElGamalAbs(java.lang.String dlogName)
           throws FactoriesException,
                  SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name to create and sets it to the underlying group. Uses default implementation of SecureRandom.
        Parameters:
        dlogName - must be DDH secure.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if the creation of the dlog failed.
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group is not DDH secure

      • ElGamalAbs

        public ElGamalAbs(java.lang.String dlogName,
          java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
           throws FactoriesException,
                  java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                  SecurityLevelException
        Constructor that gets a DlogGroup name to create and random number generator to use.
        Parameters:
        dlogName - must be DDH secure.
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if the creation of the dlog failed.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the given random number generator is not supported.
        SecurityLevelException - if the Dlog Group is not DDH secure

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
          java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initializes this ElGamal encryption scheme with (public, private) key pair. After this initialization the user can encrypt and decrypt messages.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be ElGamalPublicKey.
        privateKey - should be ElGamalPrivateKey.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given keys are not instances of ElGamal keys.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initializes this ElGamal encryption scheme with public key. Setting only the public key the user can encrypt messages but can not decrypt messages.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be ElGamalPublicKey
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key is not instances of ElGamalPuclicKey.

        public boolean isKeySet()
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Checks if this AsymmetricEnc object has been previously initialized with corresponding keys.

        Specified by:

        Returns:

        false otherwise.

      • getPublicKey

        public java.security.PublicKey getPublicKey()
        Returns the PublicKey of this ElGamal encryption scheme. This function should not be use to check if the key has been set. To check if the key has been set use isKeySet function.
        Specified by:
        getPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        the ElGamalPublicKey
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.

      • generateKey

        public java.security.KeyPair generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                  throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
        This function is not supported for this encryption scheme, since there is no need for parameters to generate an ElGamal key pair.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        keyParams - hold the required parameters to generate the encryption scheme's keys
        Returns:
        KeyPair holding the public and private keys relevant to the encryption scheme
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if the given parameters don't match this encryption scheme.

      • reconstructPublicKey

        public java.security.PublicKey reconstructPublicKey(KeySendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable PublicKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PublicKey object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        a new PublicKey with the data obtained as argument

      • reconstructPrivateKey

        public java.security.PrivateKey reconstructPrivateKey(KeySendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable PrivateKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PrivateKey object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructPrivateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        a new PrivateKey with the data obtained as argument

      • encrypt

        public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
        Encrypts the given message using ElGamal encryption scheme.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - contains message to encrypt. The given plaintext must match this ElGamal type.
        Returns:
        Ciphertext containing the encrypted message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Plaintext does not match this ElGamal type.

      • encrypt

        public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext,
                           java.math.BigInteger r)
        Encrypts the given plaintext using this asymmetric encryption scheme and using the given random value.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the encryption, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when more than one value is being encrypt. Instead, we decided to have an additional encrypt value that gets the random value from the user.

        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - contains message to encrypt. The given plaintext must match this ElGamal type.
        r - The random value to use in the encryption.
        Returns:
        Ciphertext containing the encrypted message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Plaintext does not match this ElGamal type.
